data.title: The Atlanta Rhythm Section
data.text:
ATLANTA RHYTHM SECTION

NEWS RELEASE - For Immediate Release

The Atlanta Rhythm Section Launches New Music Web Site

New web site highlights band activities, band history and a discography among the best on the Internet.

Atlanta, Georgia - January 14, 2003 --The Atlanta Rhythm Section (ARS) announced today the launch of a new state-of-the-art band web-site, www.atlantarhythmsection.com, designed to provide in-depth information about the band to its fans throughout the world. The modernized ARS web site coincides with additional band marketing activities targeted for the "new year" and features multimedia presentations showcasing the band's history and music, a detailed history of the band and one of the most comprehensive discography's on the web.

"We've got a very loyal group of fans out there and we're happy to be able to offer a web site that keeps us connected with those fans," said Barry Bailey, ARS lead guitar player and band manager. "We look forward to updating the site with information on our upcoming concert dates and other information about the band during 2003," continued Bailey.

The modernized web site can be accessed at http://www.atlantarhythmsection.com.

The Atlanta Rhythm Section achieved widespread popularity and success as part of the Southern Rock wave in the 1970's. In the years since, the band established a legacy that places it among the premiere Classic Rock bands in the world. ARS has been touring for over 30 years, playing with many of the pre-eminent Southern and Classic Rock bands. The band continues to be an active touring group today - playing mostly in the South, but also at other venues throughout the country.

ARS released their first album in 1972 and released a total of 16 original albums. Among their biggest recorded hits were "Spooky", "So In To You", "Imaginary Lover", "Not Gonna Let it Bother Me Tonight" and "Champagne Jam." These were just a few of the most popular songs from an extensive recorded catalog of outstanding songwriting and excellent musicianship that has stood the test of time.

The modernized Atlanta Rhythm Section music web site was produced for ARS by Washington D.C. area marketing and communications firms N-Group Communications, Inc. and Nauset Communications. With more than 40 years of combined marketing and communications experience, N-Group and Nauset focus on a variety of "new media" solutions for clients in the entertainment field and other areas.

For further information on ARS, N-Group Communications, Inc. or Nauset Communications, use the contact information below:

Contact Information:
